data.title: Comfortable room and friendly staff made me want to stay longer!
data.text: I arrived after a long drive (all day from Chicago) and was VERY grateful to be welcomed by a friendly and efficient woman at the front desk who checked me in quickly. I traveled alone and King room was beautiful and spacious...most importantly comfortable! I slept great and they offered a lot of choices for their complimentary breakfast. It may not have been the tastiest food but, again, there were plenty of choices. I left for Texas shortly after breakfast but wished I could of brought the room with me!

data.title: Great nights resi
data.text: Spent only night but it was the best sleep I have had in awhile. I asked at the front desk what brand the mattress was but they did not know as I would purchase one for my home.  I did have a good experience and will stay there again.

owner_response.author: bob P, Front Office Manager at Baymont Inn & Suites North Little Rock, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Dear Jerry, I am pleased to hear you had a great nights rest on our Beauty Rest Recharge style mattress the style is 360 treavor. Hope this helps you purchase your new bed.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: It was alright
data.text: Internet was so non-existent that it shouldn't have been advertised as being available 😠 Other than that, I enjoyed my stay.

owner_response.author: bob P, Front Office Manager at Baymont Inn & Suites North Little Rock, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Sorry you could not get the internet up and going if you ever stay again make sure you let front desk know so we can get you up and going. The Guest business center always has internet up and going for your convince. Guest rooms are only equipped to run 2GB per room
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: New motel
data.text: This Baymont has been open for only a short time. the decor is strikingly modern (think Ikea showroom) which I liked and my wife didn't. A few flaws still need to be worked out, most notably an ineptly installed toilet paper holder that wouldn't let the roll turn and a desk chair too low for the high desk. At least at the moment restaurants are a few miles away. The directions given on the website list the wrong exit from I-40 (should be 152A) and the lodging signs along the interstate have not yet been updated to reflect its existence. Breakfast was adequate, with sausages and scrambled egg patties replacing the typical waffle maker.

owner_response.author: bob P, Owner at Baymont Inn & Suites North Little Rock, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you Mark S. For your comments and suggestions. We will contact the online source and update the exit information. As for the Highway signs they are updating the signs as we speak. Thank you for your suggestions in the toilet paper roll placement and positioning of office chair. We would love for you to stop back by on your way through next time. It has been a pleasure meeting you and your wife as well.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice and new.
data.text: Overall the experience was positive, but when I asked how late the pool was open, the clerk told me 10:00. When I went down to the pool it was covered (and looked like it had been for some time) as if closed for the season. The pool was obviously not usable at the time the clerk told me it was open until 10:00. Also the toilet paper roller was not installed properly and the toilet paper was jammed up and the only way to use it was to remove it from the roller. It would not take much to fix this and was somewhat irritating. I have noticed this in other rooms at this location.

owner_response.author: bob P, Owner at Baymont Inn & Suites North Little Rock, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your recent stay at Baymont Inn and Suites, North Little rock, AR.
Yes the pool has been closed due to seasonal temperatures dropping so quickly.  

Your business is very important to us and we value your feedback. By telling us what you liked about your stay and how we can improve, you are helping us deliver a superior experience for you and other guests in the future. We hope you will come back and see us again soon.


Sincerely,

Bob Patel
General Manager
Baymont Inn and Suites
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Our room was very clean, it was quiet, and we were able to...
data.text: Our room was very clean, it was quiet, and we were able to rest when we needed to. I would definitely suggest a stay at Baymont to anyone!

data.title: Here we are again at Baymont Inn & Suites
data.text: We've stayed in many Baymont Inns and they have always been very clean and neat.  This one was no exception.  Check in was quick and easy and our room was ready for us when we arrived.  When I couldn't get connected to the WiFi, the gentleman at the front desk helped me link up, smiling all the while.  The hotel was very quiet and we were able to relax before heading to our next destination.

owner_response.author: bob P, Owner at Baymont Inn & Suites North Little Rock, responded to this review

data.title: This hotel is a one of a kind : Amazing
data.text: The breakfast changed everyday with Bacon, sausage, eggs, biscuit and gray, bagels, muffins, Fruit, donuts, waffles, cereal. ect. It was great! This hotel just reopened in April and is so clean I would eat off the floors. I felt safe and right at home. Beds were perfect and slept like a baby could not even tell I was located right off hwy. Staff was so kind and helpful. If you could live in the hotel I would. I travel monthly from state to state and this is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in. Keep up the great atmosphere, I will definitely be back.

owner_response.author: bob P, Owner at Baymont Inn & Suites North Little Rock, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Mr. London, 
I want to Thank you for your recent stay at Baymont Inn and Suites, North Little rock, AR. Your comments are greatly appreciated and hope you come back to see us. 

Your business is very important to us and we value your feedback. By telling us what you liked about your stay and how we can improve, you are helping us deliver a superior experience for you and other guests in the future. We hope you will come back and see us again soon.

data.title: Texas
data.text: Newly remodeled, very clean with a comfortable room. Not comfortable with location and can be very confusing to find the property. Young man on night shift did not know anything about the area at all: not where you might eat or how get back to interstate.  Second and last stay in N Little Rock.

data.title: New and clean, but not very comfortable.
data.text: King size bed had 18" pillows.  Temperature hard to regulate as it was either way too cold or very warm. Breakfast was below average.

data.title: overall review
data.text: All was good except had to ask for paper products in bath after arrival.  Hope to dee points on website for staying.

data.title: The "hot" breakfast and elevators
data.text: The breakfast was somewhat lacking compared to other Baymont's and the elevators alarms were constantly going off which left us feeling scared to ride them. Thank goodness we were only on the second floor! The accommodations were very CLEAN and new looking :-)

owner_response.author: bob P, General Manager at Baymont Inn & Suites North Little Rock, responded to this review
owner_response.text:

data.title: Beds too hard
data.text: Beds too hard, breakfast not very good-but edible.  Check in and out was easy.  Rooms were clean.  Room view is a parking lot.

data.title: MS to MO
data.text: We stopped overnight 9/4/16.  The hotel is new, bed comfortable, large TV, modern decor is  nice. Light fixture base near bed was loose and cardboard had been installed to tighten causing electrical breaker to go off and no electricity in entire room until Attendant turned breaker back on The toilet tissue holder way purposefully improperly installed so that it requires both hands to get one piece of toilet  tissue.  I mentioned this to lady at front desk who told me all rooms are this way.  A cost saving feature?  Breakfast was not up to Baymont standards.  No fruit, yogurt was spoiled, eggs were way overcooked. No newspaper.  Nice property but manager needs to be more considerate of guests.

data.title: Arkansas stay
data.text: It was new but didn't seemed to be complete.  The sink in the kitchen area had bare pipes showing.  Seems like there should be cabinets or doors.  It was fine but not the nicest hotel that I have stayed.

data.title: its new
data.text: New hotel, nicely done, good hot breakfast. We stayed in room 214, had two queen beds that were comfortable, room was quiet, good stay.

data.title: Opened to soon!
data.text: The  staff was very friendly. This is a new hotel and it isn't complete yet. Carpets in the room weren't tacked down. They bath faucet wasn't in the wall. There were holes around the electrical outlets. There were in mattresses in the gym area. The tv remotes did t work u less you were standing directly in front of the tv. The breakfast was standard but not like the other Wyndham hotels I have stayed at. They need more room because people were taking food to their room and even eating in the lobby. The room was huge and very clean. They just need to finish it and it will be a great hotel.

data.title: not a great experience
data.text: The reservations weren't what we had made over the phone, but that was corrected. The hotel had only been open for three months, but some of the rooms appeared non-completed.  The hall carpet was already frayed near the elevator and there were no window coverings on the hall windows.  The breakfast was the worst that I've ever seen put out.  Breads were frozen and the coffee never made correctly.  Also, the microwave didn't work.  The room rates were very high for the lack of quality.  I can't recommend this hotel.

data.title: Excellent value
data.text: The Baymont Inn and Suites in North Little Rock was terrific. The staff, all I came in contact with, were kind and helpful. We arrived late at night and were checking in when three other tired parties arrived. The woman was friendly and efficient. The breakfast was on the carby side, but edible. We were very pleased the décor and well maintained facility. Also, easy freeway access was helpful.

data.title: Better than expected
data.text:
When I got there the front desk gave me the room key but the room wasn't completely ready. Saw the housekeeping lady in the hallway and she was very nice/polite. Completed the make ready service by the 
time I went for my bags. The walls are insulated so you don't hear your neighbors. Motorcycle convention was in town and couldn't hear anything inside or outside the hotel. The breakfast changed daily. Very relaxing stay.
